typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Abbreviation
typeDescription.description: An abbreviation is a letter or group of letters, taken from a word or words. For example, the word "abbreviation" can be abbreviated as "abbr." or "abbrev."

featureDescription.name: fullForm
featureDescription.description: The full form of an abbreviation. The full form, for example for HLA could be human leukocyte antigen.

featureDescription.name: textReference
featureDescription.description: Reference to the text span that contains the full form of the abbreviation/acronym.

featureDescription.name: definedHere
featureDescription.description: This feature is true if the abbreviation/acronym is defined for the first time in the text, e.g. in "interleukin 2 (Il-2) receptor", it can be true only for locally introduced abbreviations/acronyms.

featureDescription.name: stems
featureDescription.description: Stems of the full form.

featureDescription.name: segments
featureDescription.description: Segments of the full form.

featureDescription.name: tokens
featureDescription.description: Token strings of the full form.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Abstract
typeDescription.description: Semantic abstract section found in the text.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Category
typeDescription.description: Category meta information on the document or a region of this document (use the context feature to identify which section this category refers to). E.g. language information of the document text or language information of specific sections.

featureDescription.name: group
featureDescription.description: The category group (e.g. HSG, language) to which from which the label belongs. For language categorization the group might be "lang" and then the labels could be "en", "de", "fr" etc.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label of the category annotation. E.g. in the case that we identified languages (de, en, fr, ...).

featureDescription.name: context
featureDescription.description: The text context which belongs to the given category annotation, e.g. Document, Section, Sentence.

featureDescription.name: rank
featureDescription.description: The rank of the current category with respect to the context.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Chunk
typeDescription.description: A general type for chunks (NPs, VPs, PPs etc.). Note: there are 3 specific subtypes for common chunks: ChunkNP, ChunkVP, ChunkPP. For all other chunk types (e.g., SBAR; ADJP etc.) use this general type!

featureDescription.name: enclosedTokens
featureDescription.description: The Token annotations enclosed by this chunk.

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: The head entity on which this chunk grammatically depends. Example: in "Der Vater des Kindes" is "der Vater" the head of "des Kindes".

featureDescription.name: dependents
featureDescription.description: The entities which grammatically depend on this chunk. Example: in "Der Vater des Kindes" is "des Kindes" the dependent of "Der Vater".

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The specific chunk tag as returned by the chunker (e.g., "NP", "SBAR", "S" etc.).

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.ChunkNP
typeDescription.description: A noun phrase (e.g. "the strange bird").

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.ChunkPP
typeDescription.description: A prepositional phrase (e.g. "in between").

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.ChunkVP
typeDescription.description: A verb phrase (e.g. "has been thinking").

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Concept
typeDescription.description: A concept is a reference to an entry in a database, terminology, taxonomy, ontology etc.

featureDescription.name: dictCanon
featureDescription.description: Canonical form (preferred term).

featureDescription.name: enclosingSpan
featureDescription.description: The span that this concept is contained within (i.e. its sentence).

featureDescription.name: negatedBy
featureDescription.description: Indicates which annotation negates the concept.

featureDescription.name: partialMatch
featureDescription.description: Specifies if the annotation matches the complete context. E.g. if coveredText is "Lungenabschnitte" and the generated Concept annotation is "Lunge", then this value is set to true.

featureDescription.name: matchedText
featureDescription.description: The text in document which matched the synonym (in the respective mapping mode form, i.e., segment/stem/original etc.).

featureDescription.name: matchedTerm
featureDescription.description: The synonym of the concept which caused the match.

featureDescription.name: matchedVariant
featureDescription.description: The variant of the synonym of the concept which caused the match. Note that one synonym (matchedTerm) can have several variants (i.e. spelling forms or mapping forms).

featureDescription.name: matchedTokens
featureDescription.description: The Token annotations on which the concept was found. Note that there is also matchedAnnotations which list the actual annotations involved in the matching process (i.e., token, stem, segment, etc.).

featureDescription.name: matchedAnnotations
featureDescription.description: List of the actual annotations involved in the matching process (i.e., original, stem, segment, etc.). Note that there is also matchedTokens, which lists only matching Token annotations.

featureDescription.name: mappingMode
featureDescription.description: The mode used for mapping (e.g., original, stem, segment...).

featureDescription.name: mappingFuzzynessScore
featureDescription.description: The score for the fuzzyness of the mapping (higher scores mean higher fuzzyness, i.e., less exact mappings).

featureDescription.name: uniqueID
featureDescription.description: The unique concept id, including terminology name and concept ID should look like this: 'terminologyName':'conceptID'.

featureDescription.name: conceptID
featureDescription.description: The concept id. For a unique id refer to uniqueID.

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The name of the terminology source.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.CoreAnnotation
typeDescription.description: The base type for all annotation types providing a componentId and confidence.

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: The id/name of the component that created this annotation.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: Confidence value of the current annotation. E.g. in the case the annotation has been created by a statistical analysis engine.

featureDescription.name: confidenceKind
featureDescription.description: Additional information about the specific kind of confidence. This provides an option to indicate if the confidence feature is set at all.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Descriptor
typeDescription.description: An index term from an ontology; its type (or reference) is written in the feature annotation.

featureDescription.name: uid
featureDescription.description: The unique identifier of the descriptor, e.g., a combination of terminology and concept id.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Entity
typeDescription.description: A named entity; not to be confused with a Concept. A (named) entity is a string representation in text referring to a class of entities. Thus, the entity mention does not have an identifier but a specific type (the category) assigned to it.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: This feature provides the text of the annotated mention. Important for easily representing discontinuous mentions such as 'T cell' in the expression 'T and B cell'.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The type of the entity; e.g., PERSON, LOCATION etc. Feature name is label due to the fact that "type" is a reserved word.

featureDescription.name: parsedElements
featureDescription.description: Reference to all recognized entities inside this Entity such as Size, Time, Area, Date, Volume, ....

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Enumeration
typeDescription.description: A specific group representing an enumeration like "red, blue and green".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.GenericMetadata
typeDescription.description: Type holding generic metadata information of a document. Multiple annotations should be used to add additional metadata to the CAS.

featureDescription.name: metadataFieldname
featureDescription.description: To reduce the potential metadata field names, the predefined field names should be used where possible (add new field names if necessary). Predefined metadata field names are: title, summary, filesize, annotatorName.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Value of the metadata field, e.g. metadataFieldname = title, value = "Brave new world".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Group
typeDescription.description: Groups together a set of annotations that belong together, e.g., enumerations. One of them can be set to the "leading" concept. E.g. "the liver metastasis is hypodense and has a size of 3cm*2cm". lead: metastasis, other concepts: liver, hypodense, 3cm*2cm

featureDescription.name: leadingAnnotation
featureDescription.description: Optional annotation indicating the leading head of hte group.

featureDescription.name: members
featureDescription.description: Annotations contained in the group.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: Textual label describing the group elements.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Header
typeDescription.description: The header annotation of a document

featureDescription.name: docID
featureDescription.description: The ID of the document.

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The source of the document.

featureDescription.name: path
featureDescription.description: The path of the document.

featureDescription.name: fileName
featureDescription.description: The name of the source file (often used by cas consumers which produce an output file for each CAS; this name is used as base).

featureDescription.name: fileEncoding
featureDescription.description: The encoding of the file.

featureDescription.name: documentIndex
featureDescription.description: The current number of the documents, i.e. a document is number 5 in a complete sequence.

featureDescription.name: lastFile
featureDescription.description: Indicates if this is the last file.

featureDescription.name: sourceLanguage
featureDescription.description: The document language of the source.

featureDescription.name: offsetInSource
featureDescription.description: Byte offset of the start of document content within original source file or other input source. Only used if the CAS document was retrieved from an source where one physical source file contained several conceptual documents. Zero otherwise.

featureDescription.name: documentSize
featureDescription.description: Size of original document in bytes before processing by CAS Initializer. Either absolute file size of size within file or other source.

featureDescription.name: sequenceNumber
featureDescription.description: Sequence number to test the right order while merging CASes.

featureDescription.name: lastSegment
featureDescription.description: For a CAS that represents a segment of a larger source document, this flag indicates whether this CAS is the final segment of the source document. This is useful for downstream components that want to take some action after having seen all of the segments of a particular source document.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.IndexTerm
typeDescription.description: A term to be used for indexing a document.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The string representation of the index term. Example: the normalized and stemmed string which represents a keyword in the free keywording scenario or for controlled keywording (=descriptor extraction) the dictCanon might be written here.

featureDescription.name: baseAnnotation
featureDescription.description: The annotation to be assigned as index term. This can i.e. be a Concept or a Noun Phrase annotation from which the index term was derived.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.InputParam
typeDescription.description: InputParam is used to pass parameters to an analysis engine via a JCas object. This may be used to pass parameters in the process() method of an analysis engine rather than during initialization of the AEs. It is e.g. necessary for the ConceptAnnotator at which you want to pass restrictions (such as "language" or "terminology") for each single text/jcas while only having one ConceptAnnotator instance.

featureDescription.name: key
featureDescription.description: The key of the input parameter.

featureDescription.name: values
featureDescription.description: The values of the input parameter.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Keyword
typeDescription.description: A keyword that is assigned freely (i.e., not taken from an ontology) to a document. Its type is written in the feature annotation

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Lemma is the canonical form of a lexeme. Lemmata can be retrieved from lexicon or be produced by lemmatizer.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the lemma.

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case such as Nom (Nominative) or Gen (Genitive) etc.

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Singular or plural.

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: fem or masc or neutr.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Listing
typeDescription.description: A specific group representing a listing like "1. red 2. blue 3. green".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Member
typeDescription.description: Utility annotation for indicating a member of a group.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTag
typeDescription.description: Parent type for all specific part-of-speech types.

featureDescription.name: tagsetId
featureDescription.description: The name of the tag set the pos tag belongs to; e.g. the "Penn Treebank II Tags" (see http://bulba.sdsu.edu/jeanette/thesis/PennTags.html)

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The specific part-of-speech tag, as returned by the POS-Tagger (e.g., "NN" or "ADJ" etc)

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagAdj
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Adjective".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagAdp
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Preposition/Postposition".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagAdv
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Adverb".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagConj
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Conjunction".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagDet
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Determiner".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagNoun
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Noun".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagNum
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Numeral".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagPart
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Particle".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagPron
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Pronoun".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagPunct
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Punctuation".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.POSTagVerb
typeDescription.description: The type for all POS-Tags of the type "Verb".

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Paragraph
typeDescription.description: Different paragraphs found in the document.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Relation
typeDescription.description: Describes a binary relation between two annotations. The relation is defined according to the SPO (subject, predicate, object) annotation.

featureDescription.name: subject
featureDescription.description: An annotation representing the subject of the relation ("agens").

featureDescription.name: predicate
featureDescription.description: The annotation representing the predicate of the relation.

featureDescription.name: object
featureDescription.description: The object of the relation.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Type of the relation.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.ResolvedEntity
typeDescription.description: A special entity with an additional specific resolved form.

featureDescription.name: resolvedType
featureDescription.description: The type of the resolved form.

featureDescription.name: resolvedForm
featureDescription.description: A string representing the resolved form of the entity.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Section
typeDescription.description: Text sections of a certain type.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Segment
typeDescription.description: The segmentation of a text part; a segment is usually a subword (i.e., part of a token).

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The string representation of the segment.

featureDescription.name: kind
featureDescription.description: Optional kind of segmentation for simultaneous representation of multiple segment layers.

featureDescription.name: isValidSegmentation
featureDescription.description: Indicates if the segmentation is valid (viz. could be completely matched against the dictionary).

featureDescription.name: midStrings
featureDescription.description: The MID value, multiple for ambiguous MIDs (for MID see Morphosaurus Paper).

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Sentence
typeDescription.description: Annotation representing a sentence including the ending punctuation mark.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Stem
typeDescription.description: The type for stem annotations.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The string representation of the stem.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.SummarySentence
typeDescription.description: Annotation indicating a sentence that makes up a summary of the document.

featureDescription.name: sentence
featureDescription.description: The sentence annotation that contains the content of this summary sentence.

featureDescription.name: descriptors
featureDescription.description: The descriptors extracted by the algorithm accounting to the selection of the sentence.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Title
typeDescription.description: Marks a title in the document.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Annotation for basic textual units including word, numbers and punctuation marks.

featureDescription.name: posTag
featureDescription.description: The part of speech of this token (i.a. used for concept annotator to be restricted to certain pos types).

featureDescription.name: segments
featureDescription.description: Segments of this token (i.a. used for respective mode in concept annotator).

featureDescription.name: stem
featureDescription.description: The stem of the token (i.a. used for respective mode in concept annotator).

featureDescription.name: isAbbreviation
featureDescription.description: Marker whether the token is (part of) an abbreviation.

featureDescription.name: abbreviations
featureDescription.description: The abbreviations for the token; this may be used as replacement in concept annotator. Note, that this goes in combination with "isAbbreviation" marking whether the token is an abbreviation. Multiple entries mean that there is ambiguity which full form is correct. There will be components to resolve this ambiguity which then remove wrong forms. Components which cannot do this ambiguity resolution must rely that the first (and hopefully only) entry is correct!

featureDescription.name: ignoreByConceptMapper
featureDescription.description: If this feature is true then the ConceptAnnotator ignores the token. Use this is a pre-processing component has already identified the semantic of the token. E.g. dates, times, measurement values. Default value: false

featureDescription.name: normalized
featureDescription.description: Normalized version of this token (usually lower-case, without special characters and number).

featureDescription.name: diacriticsFreeVersions
featureDescription.description: In the case that the normalized version contains diacritics, multiple versions without diacritics are stored in this array.

featureDescription.name: isStopword
featureDescription.description: Indicates if the token is a stopword.

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The Lemma of the token.

featureDescription.name: isInvariant
featureDescription.description: Defines whether a token is an invariant. Such a token should not undergo some morphologic analysis steps, such as stemming and/or decompounding. However, lemmatization might still be allowed. Typical invariants: IL-2 (gene name) or also product names or numbers (SR-2715) but also too short words (au).

featureDescription.name: tokenClass
featureDescription.description: The optional string representing the class of the token concerning its surface form.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.ValidTextSegment
typeDescription.description: Zone to mark valid text in contrast to invalid text which e.g. may be OCR (Optical Character Recognition) artefacts, number blocks, tables etc.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.extraction.types.Zone
typeDescription.description: An annotation concerning the document structure, e.g. header, title, abstract, etc.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: Allows to annotated the Zone with a semantic label. E.g. in the case of a section the value might be Introduction, Appendix,...

featureDescription.name: weight
featureDescription.description: The relevance or weight for a zone; used e.g. to weight information contained in the respective zone.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.Deidentifiable
typeDescription.description: Internal type for representing replacements during deidentification.

featureDescription.name: replacement
featureDescription.description: The textual replacement for the identified text span.

featureDescription.name: replacementKind
featureDescription.description: The approach of the replacement.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DeidentifiedDocument
typeDescription.description: A deidentified version of the document.

featureDescription.name: kind
featureDescription.description: The kind of method applied in order to deidentify the document.

featureDescription.name: deidentifiedText
featureDescription.description: The deidentified version of the document.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHI
typeDescription.description: Protected health information.

featureDescription.name: kind
featureDescription.description: Fine-grained kind of the type of protected health information.

featureDescription.name: coarseKind
featureDescription.description: Coarse kind of the type of protected health information.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIAge
typeDescription.description: Age of the patient.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIBioId
typeDescription.description: Mentions of a specific id.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIBirthDate
typeDescription.description: Mention of a birth date.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHICity
typeDescription.description: Mention of a city.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHICommonDate
typeDescription.description: Mention of a common date.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIContact
typeDescription.description: Contact information like phone, fax, email, url or IP.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHICountry
typeDescription.description: Mention of a country.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIDate
typeDescription.description: Mention of a date.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIDeathDate
typeDescription.description: Mention of a death date.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIDevice
typeDescription.description: Mentions of specific device.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIDoctor
typeDescription.description: Mention of doctor's name or another staff member.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIEmail
typeDescription.description: Mention of an email address.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIFax
typeDescription.description: Mention of a fax number.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIHealthPlan
typeDescription.description: Mentions of a health plan id.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIHospital
typeDescription.description: Mention of a hospital.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIID
typeDescription.description: Different kinds of IDs like social security numbers, medical record number or health plan number.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIIDNum
typeDescription.description: Mentions of specific IDs.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHILocation
typeDescription.description: Location information like hospital, street, city or country.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHILocationOther
typeDescription.description: Mention of an unspecific location.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIMedicalRecord
typeDescription.description: Mentions of specific medical record numbers/ids.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIName
typeDescription.description: Name of a person.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHINameOther
typeDescription.description: Mention of another person not linked to the patient or doctors.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHINameTitle
typeDescription.description: Mention of title of a person.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIOrganization
typeDescription.description: Mention of an organization.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIOther
typeDescription.description: Mention of other PHI.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIPatient
typeDescription.description: Mention of the patient's name or another person's name like a relative or representative of the patient.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIPhone
typeDescription.description: Mention of a phone number.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIProfession
typeDescription.description: Mention of a profession.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHISentence
typeDescription.description: An additional representation that indicates if a sentence contains PHI.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: Information if the sentence contains PHI: PHI or OTHER

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIState
typeDescription.description: Mention of a state.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIStreet
typeDescription.description: Mention of a street.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIUrl
typeDescription.description: Mention of a URL.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIUsername
typeDescription.description: Mention of username.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.PHIZip
typeDescription.description: Mention of a zip code.
